quoteFirst: The pit was one of several found in the area and formerly was used as a source of limestone gravel used in constructing the road between Champotón and Escárcega. The exposed limestone substratum was overlaid with chalky soil
title: Summer Birds From the Yucatan Peninsula, Mexico
author: Klaas, Erwin E.

quoteFirst: On the 13th, in latitude 4° 44' south and longitude 23° 17' west, a swallow, a gannet, and two sheerwaters were seen; and from
quoteLast: in the evening, the officer of the watch and myself thought the water to be much smoother than before, or than it was afterward. Had it been in an unknown sea, I should have been persuaded that some island, or shoal, lay at no great distance to the south-eastward of our situation at that time.
title:
A Voyage to Terra Australis — Volume 1
Undertaken for the purpose of completing the discovery of that vast country, and prosecuted in the years 1801, 1802 and 1803, in His Majesty's ship the Investigator, and subsequently in the armed vessel Porpoise and Cumberland schooner
author: Flinders, Matthew, 1774-1814

quoteFirst: In this his second visit to Darfur, Gordon had ascertained that the Sudanese merchants of El Obeid had been selling arms and powder to the rebel Suleiman, with whom they naturally sympathised for their own selfish purposes; this contraband of war had been secretly despatched to Bahr el Ghazal through the intermediary of the Gellabas (petty traders), who obtained enormous prices from Suleiman: for instance,
quoteLast: slaves would be exchanged for a double-barrelled gun, and one or two slaves was the price of a box of caps. The officials at El Obeid made some attempt to check this trade, but the difficulties were great.
title:
Fire and Sword in the Sudan
A Personal Narrative of Fighting and Serving the Dervishes 1879-1895
author: Slatin, Rudolf Carl, Freiherr von, 1857-1932; Wingate, F. R. (Francis Reginald), Sir, 1861-1953 [Translator]

quoteFirst: The scheme is only given here in six gradations of tone. As a matter of fact, a good autotype has at least from
quoteLast: times the number of tones, as with a sharp screen and an original cleanly {72} and sharply drawn in many tones, the light reflects the least alteration of tone in the size of the grain.
title: Photo-Lithography
author: Fritz, Georg, 1851-; Wall, E. J. (Edward John), 1860-1928 [Translator]

quoteFirst: , according to taste; or cane bottoms with cushions which should be covered with the same material as the bed and window curtains. He was fond of the "Duchess," which consisted of two Barjeer or arm-chairs with a stool between them, all three pieces fitting together at pleasure and making a lounge from
quoteLast: feet long. His press-beds vary little in appearance from wardrobes, but it was in smaller and daintier pieces that his particular talent found play. His knife-boxes are extremely elegant, particularly when in urn shape with a rod in the centre to prevent the top of the urn from being removed.
title: The Old Furniture Book, with a Sketch of Past Days and Ways
author: Moore, N. Hudson, 1857-1927

quoteLast: pounds, which Conrad later would promptly regain.
title: Beyond Bedlam

quoteFirst: These are the Tufted Horse-shoe Vetch (_Hippocrepis comosa_) and the Sainfoin or Cock's-head (_Onobrychis sativa_). The former, represented on Plate VIII, is a low, smooth, prostrate plant,
quoteLast: een inches long, with yellow flowers that bloom from May to August. This plant is sometimes confused with the Bird's-foot Trefoil, which it rather closely resembles in general appearance, but it may be readily distinguished by the pinnate leaves and the peculiar form of the pods.
title: Field and Woodland Plants
author: Furneaux, William S.; Wilson, Patten, 1869-1934 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: If the ground is _very_ clean, it may be sown broadcast; but it is always safer and often _necessary_ to drill it. Authors vary as to the quantity of seed required per acre, Von Thaër says
quoteLast: pounds, while his French editor says from sixteen to eighteen. We suppose that from ten to twelve pounds will be a fair amount.
title: Pleasant Talk About Fruits, Flowers and Farming
author: Beecher, Henry Ward, 1813-1887
